title: I mean I LOVE the new Taric A LOT, but I am afraid...
body:
I am afraid that you are going to nerf him. His synergy is solid in a game with other people. There, he is an ok champion at best. But when you go duo with him, and you are in a skype call with your ADC? He is freaking outrageous. From the insane AoE stuns, to the coordinated invulnerable dives, you just can't compete with him.

I especially fear for the competitive level. It happens all the time where teams will go straight for early level dives, especially in this meta. Now when Taric hits level six, the team can get an almost effortless dive, with no risks whatsoever. I mean in a normal game with average players, you will have to act swiftly to kill someone under turret and get out with the seemingly short invincibility. But on a pro team? That small window is enough to get a triple kill from a dive and get out of there without a sweat.

The only saving grace for this is that he can get countered by  CC, and the fact that the mobility creep is getting more and more relevant.

Thoughts?

P.S. You need to nerf how fun he is and how annoying it is to spam his joke. It's way too fabulous for the average player to handle.

replies.body: It's likely we'll be nerfing Taric in 6.9. Not sure what yet, still assessing exactly where/when he's too strong. So far though he's performing significantly stronger than he should however so we'll need to do something.

Hey Meddler, I know this is off topic but I've been curious as to why Soraka is receiving nerfs on top of GW being reverted. This in itself is a huge and necessary nerf to Soraka. As a main, I welcome it with open arms!

But why is she receiving nerfs along with the GW changes? The .05(.20) buff to Rejuvenation is barely a compensation. Will Wish continue to not remove GW? And if it will, will it grant temporary immunity to GW? Morellos applies GW for 8s conpared to 4s on live, which is HUGE now that GW is affecting ***all*** heals.

We feel Soraka's too strong at present. The GW change should help reduce that somewhat, estimation is not enough though. Under other circumstances we'd potentially wait and see what's needed post 6.9 like we're doing with champs the QSS changes may affect. Belief is though that the Athene's changes will be a noticeable buff to her however so we're looking at some nerfs as a result.

Reintroducing some form of GW interaction with Wish is an option if GW starts shutting her down too hard in 6.9.

A second problem I foresee with him is that the current armor itematisation for supports is pretty underwhelming:

* {{item:3110}} feels ok, it's not really that you can ballance an aura item perfectly.
* {{item:3050}} need some changes. Marksmen can easy get to 60% crit and it's not that you can activate it on command. That stats are nice but the active just feels underwhelming right now.
* {{item:2053}} not sure you still intend to make this viable for supports. But right now it's to expensive for that purpose.
* {{item:3056}} has nice stats that supports really could use. But the active is so useless it's not even worth thinking about it. It would be a nice line for supports since {{item:3512}} can be a pretty intressting option. But lack of option can be a reason you wouldn't go for it. Taking risks is nice, but since taking a situational item is already risky I doubt I would take a risk 2 times in a row. The support role is just not designed for that. Better go ful AP Sona instead.

I think a change to look into would be the bastion buddy range.

As old Taric main with pretty nice winrate I have to say that new Taric is very unfun to play against - his skillset is just too annoying . Previously Taric has some agressive skills, but he had to pay for you - some of his armor for example. New Taric doesn't pay anything for risky plays and procs of his passive. He procs his skillshot stun in melee range so he can't miss it - same situation like with Rengar bola. Skill has to be skillshot and get nice power in exchange, but nobody uses it like skillshot. Taric even can run away from you and stun you if you'll try to follow him! Without stopping. 
All new Taric now is about - breaking enemy plans. It can be fun for Taric, but not for the rest of players.

Ult effect is uneclear and most of his effects too. When Kayle immortal - you can clearly see that, with Taric it's a problem. He has so much stuff flying around him all the time, and you can't understand is this one more bubble is ult already or not? Taric's ADCs don't like it too, because they can't understand when Taric's ult is started.
I'm finding Taric to be doing a lot of damage for not building much of it, mostly on his own in the early-mid stages. His auto attack weaving seems strong.

There were times in my first 5 or 6 games playing him that I would be in the middle of the dragon pit with Taric and a teammate would get pulled over the wall by say a blitzcrank or darius pull, and I would have no trouble putting my Bastion on them. And then casting any spells afterwards would also be no problem as the tether range outclasses the cast range, but maybe that range is a bit too far.

Oh also I wanted to mention. What happens with Trynd + Kayle + Taric.

The durations are almost perfect. Undying rage into Intervention into Cosmic Radiance. Even without Tryndamere; 5 seconds is a long time to keep someone CC'd so they can't walk on the team. Then you have Kindred and Zilean ults (Taric looks like he can go top or Zilean can go mid) It doesn't look like it needs much effort to create a team at the moment that refuses to die :P

I feel like Dazzle's delay is a little too short given its casting paradigm. It doesn't seem much longer than something like Nami's Q, and Taric being able to move during that delay + seeming to have no cast animation that cancels movement when the spell begins seems like it's about as dependable as his old Dazzle against anyone without a dash. The optimal path for a champion to get out of the stun is a perpendicular sidestep, but Taric probably has about the same amount of movespeed as them so he can imitate them to keep them in the hitbox.

And that's before even considering the fact that his bastion'd target has their own Dazzle vector the enemy has to deal with.

As much as I like the interaction, I am going to have to suggest that you give his ult the Zilean treatment, where you make the removal of cooldowns(via Bravado) not affect his ultimate. It is good enough of an ability. where I think that is possible. You could also probably slightly increase the cooldown of his Q. What people are doing is keeping the Q at rank one and abusing its cooldown reduction for 60 mana and almost no cooldown.

Please hold off on changing him for now, as with any rework or champion release it take a while for the player base to adapt.

I actually find him pretty weak during the laning phase, his skillshot is telegraphed and  therefore relatively easy to dodge.
But more importantly he have clear wimdows of vulnerability, and if you play yoir cards right you can make him run out of mana very fast.
Meaning you'll win by attrition.

In a straight up brawl he is pretty strong, agreed but this strength comes at the expense of high mana consumption making him VERY balanced.

I understand there could be some issues in lower elo brackets where people have more trouble dodging skillshots and determining strengths, weaknesses and positoning, but that is also the reason Blitz is feared there.

So hold off a bit please and see how people adapt to him first.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lrplQ28E,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-04-22T02:48:26.422+0000)
>

I hope you dont strip out his little bit of damage that he has, like the old taric nerf direction. Playing him in solo lanes is the most fun he has been in a long time. Using w with your jungler is really satisfying, and as a major Taric player it is great that you arent absolutely glued to bottom lane. 

Ive seen the nerfs on the PBE and im concerned that continued reductions to his ability to trade will make him unviable to fight common tops like Ekko.

His heal could definitely use some improvement or maybe a small regen effect that gains strength with gems after the fact.

What if you made his ult affect enemy champions in it's Aoe too, kind of like Kindred. This would make Taric players have to think more about when they should and shouldn't ult. It would still be as effective for tower diving and surviving ganks, but at the same time, it would give the other team some counterplay during teamfights.

Fighting him, he doesn't seem nearly as obnoxious as some champions do, he actually has some fun aspects and counter play to him. (Insert salt about Soraka and my own personal tilt-Karma here) But I don't think Taric is super op.

One thing I do think is a bit much is the healing. Similar to Soraka but a fighter. Max Q, start a fight and keep pressing Q for more heals and damage.

Maybe just reduce the Q passive CD reduction to 3/4 seconds rather than 5. Being able to take 10 seconds off in what might as well be one auto attack is a bit much. Changing it to 3 or 4 is a huge reduction and already quite a large nerf but doesn't remove much of what you want new Taric to do.

As someone whose played both as and against Taric, I feel he's in a good state, but I don't think he's overpowered like pre 6.8 Ekko. There are lots of strengths and weaknesses to each of his abilities in his kit. I have found that his laning phase isn't the best compared to other supports. He tends to be irrelevant against high poke bot lanes and a lot of his lane threat comes from his e which has a long, predictable cast/charge up time. 

The places where I do think he's too strong is the dive potential he has at 6 and his team fight interaction with his ult, but the 2.5 sec to cast it is definitely not hard to deal with in a game with everyone in a party. I've seen the ult help make game changing plays, but also fail super hard when the ulted target get bursted down. 

I think he's in a decent state, but could have some tweaking. Maybe nerfing the passive and q interaction would be a good spot without removing what he brings to the team fight and laning phase. Having the q potentially on a 3 second cooldown is really strong. Maybe make it reduce the cd by 4 or 3.5 sec with the passive empowered autos. Then the q would be on a5 sec cooldown and not be spammed as often. The mana costs are very on point, meaning that Glacial is definitely needed for long, drawn out team fights. And I think his defensive stats are in a good place early game. I haven't found Taric to be hard at killing before he gets some armor items. 

I think as the week progresses with Taric people will realize the way to beat him is shut him down early and work around the ult, like Bard, but way easier. Just some thoughts so he doesn't get overnerfed and not played again.
He'll get nerfed. Probably increased CD/reduced base and probably slightly longer cast time on E.
